page.title: 02COASTAL BIRDLIFE II
page.content: The shingle areas bordering the dunes attact Snow Buntings in winter and in summer provide a nesting site for Ringed Plovers and Little Terns the latter being a rare breeding bird in Britain.Dunlin and Oystercatcher are the most common waders with Sanderling,Knot,Redshank,Curlew,Bow-Ta iled-godwit,Ringed Plover and Grey Plover also common.In late Summer the Prestatyn area sands are favoured by thousands of Sandwich, Common and Little Terns pausing on their southward migration.Herring Gulls, Great Black-Backed-Gulls, Black-Headed-Gulls and Common Gulls are numerous particularly outside the breeding season.At low tide Cormorants very often stand on the sand with wings spread.
